subject: Business
title: The Smartphone Revolution
description: A quick win: understand The Smartphone Revolution.

hook.text: The iPhone launched in 2007. Within a decade, it killed cameras, GPS devices, MP3 players, alarm clocks, and newspapers.

buildup.text: The smartphone combined a computer, camera, GPS, and internet connection into a pocket-sized device for everyone.

discovery.text: Apps turned the smartphone into an infinite tool. One device replaced dozens of single-purpose gadgets.

twist.text: Nokia had 50% market share in 2007. By 2013, it was sold to Microsoft for scraps. Disruption was total and swift.

climax.text: There are now 6.8 billion smartphone users globally. It's the fastest technology adoption in human history.

punchline.text: The most disruptive device ever made fits in your pocket.

quiz.question: What happened to Nokia after the iPhone launched?
options: Nokia lost its 50% market share and was sold to Microsoft within six years
